summary: Single-page romantic playful web app (plain HTML/CSS/JS) with centered question, Yes/No buttons, success screen with cute animation, and evasive fixed-position No button; must be published/deployed as two separate standalone builds (V1 and V2) on different links/URLs so they can be used at the same time (not combined into a single one-page version selector).
architectural_notes: Use only plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (no external libraries).
Position the 'No' button with CSS position: fixed and randomize top/left using window.innerWidth/innerHeight.
Clamp random positions so the 'No' button stays fully visible within viewport boundaries.
Handle mouseenter/hover, touch, and click events to ensure evasive movement on desktop and mobile; clicking 'No' must never trigger navigation/action.
Heading text must be exactly: "Khusnul will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è" (note the leading space in the provided copy if intentional).
Support deploying/hosting two separate standalone builds (V1 and V2) with independent entry points so they can be used concurrently.
Deployment must provide two different links/URLs for V1 and V2 (e.g., separate entry points like /v1/ and /v2/), not a single-page in-app version selector.
known_issues: Current build approach appears to combine versions into a single page/flow; user requires separate published links for each version.

existing_features.title: Create a main screen with a centered heading and two buttons beneath it. Heading text must be exactly: "Cia will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è". Buttons must be labeled exactly: "Yes üíñ" and "No üíî".

Implement the "Yes üíñ" button flow: on click/tap, navigate to a success screen that displays the exact success text "Yay! Babe I just knew that u always be mine only ‚ù£Ô∏è üíï" and subtext "Love u sayang ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è". Add a small heart or confetti-style animation on the success screen (CSS/JS-based; no external animation libraries).

Implement the "No üíî" button as an evasive button using CSS position: fixed. The button must move to a new random position anywhere within the full viewport (window.innerWidth/window.innerHeight) while always staying fully visible on screen (account for the button‚Äôs width/height).
Desktop interaction: when the mouse cursor hovers over or enters the "No üíî" button, it must immediately jump to a new random fixed position within the full viewport.
Mobile interaction: when the user taps the "No üíî" button, it must immediately move to a new random fixed position within the full viewport and must never remain in the same place after a tap.

Click safety: if the "No üíî" button receives a click/tap event anyway, it must not trigger any navigation or success state. Instead, it must immediately move again to another random fixed position. Ensure reliable movement by handling mouseenter/hover, click, and touch events.

Apply a cute, romantic, playful UI theme consistent across screens: soft pink/pastel red background, rounded buttons, smooth transitions, and fully responsive layout for mobile/desktop. Add slightly dramatic motion feel for the evasive "No üíî" button (e.g., quick jump with subtle transition), without introducing external UI libraries.

Update the main (question) screen centered heading text to exactly: "Khusnul will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è" while keeping the existing Yes/No button labels and all existing behaviors unchanged (Yes navigates to success screen; No remains evasive and fixed-position across the full viewport).

Add a simple in-app ‚Äúversion selection‚Äù entry screen that lets the user open and use both Version 1 and Version 2 independently (i.e., accessible via distinct URLs so they can be opened simultaneously in separate browser tabs/windows).

Implement ‚ÄúVersion 1‚Äù as a standalone variant of the existing romantic Yes/No experience, using the Version 1 question heading text exactly: "Cia will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è" while preserving the existing button labels and behaviors (Yes navigates to the existing success screen; No remains evasive with the same fixed-position random movement and click-safety rules).

Keep the current experience as ‚ÄúVersion 2‚Äù with the existing question heading text exactly: "Khusnul will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è" and preserve all current behaviors and styling for this version.

Remove the single-app ‚Äúversion selection‚Äù entry flow and change the frontend so Version 1 and Version 2 can be published as two separate standalone deployments, each with its own distinct URL and its own root route ('/').

Ensure each standalone deployment preserves all existing behaviors and exact texts for its version: Version 1 uses heading text exactly "Cia will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è" and Version 2 uses heading text exactly "Khusnul will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è"; both keep the existing "Yes üíñ" navigation to the success screen and the evasive "No üíî" behavior unchanged.

Add/adjust project build + deploy configuration so developers can produce and deploy two distinct frontend artifacts (Version 1 and Version 2) from the same repo, without requiring manual code edits between deployments.

new_feature_requests.summary: Main page UI: centered romantic heading with two buttons (Yes/No) on soft pink/pastel red background; rounded buttons, smooth transitions, responsive layout.
Yes button flow: click/tap redirects to success page showing specified text + subtext and a small heart/confetti-style animation.

Evasive No button behavior: positioned fixed and moves to random fully-visible viewport position on desktop hover/near-cursor and on mobile tap; also moves again on click without triggering any action.
Cross-device input handling: implement reliable mouseenter/hover, touch, and click event handlers for consistent evasive movement across screen sizes (no external libraries).
Rebuild Version 1 and Version 2 as two separate standalone apps so the user can open and use both simultaneously (instead of only one active app).

projectName: Romantic yes/no page with evasive fixed-position 'No' button and success screen
